answers.answer: I would get a second opinion. It is absolutely crucial that your "eye doctor" is a MD physician ophthalmologist and not a non-MD non-physician optometrist. Given how long you have had diabetes its most likely statistically that you have some diabetic retinopathy.Your problem could be due to corneal problems, early cataracts, diabetic retina or macular disease.I suggest you see a retina Eye MD. Find one at www.aao.org or ask your personal physician to refer you.JCH MD

question: Iam a 39 year old female with type 1 Diabetes.  Ive been Diabetic for 30 years and inject Humalog daily.  I have very dry eyes and extreamily sensitive to indoor/outdoor light.  Yes, I wear sunglasses (even on cloudy days) constantly.  sometimes indoor.  Even when driving during the day, I sometimes need to pull over because the light is so bright I cannot focus. I dont get headaches but my eyes feel heavy and tired even when I wake up in the morning.   Ive seen my eye doctor for yearly exams and everything is within normal limits.  I apply dry eye drops about 4-5 times a day.  I dont have light eyes, they are brown.  What are some options besides ripping them out of my head????   Gina
title: light sensitive eyes
